intro: Hoya fitchii, commonly known as the "Coral Hoya," is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its waxy, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces fragrant, pinkish-white blooms that are often described as resembling coral, hence its common name. Hoya fitchii is a climbing plant that thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is relatively low-maintenance and popular among houseplant enthusiasts for its ornamental value.
